Yjfa82v-M9YukuUxVPFUGw.text: I've walked by many times, but this time I went in to explore. Found a nice diner with good food. And they do an all day breakfast plate, so that's what I had. Eggs, toast, grits and bacon, along with a side of hushpuppies and and orange soda!  It was just what I needed on a lazy Saturday afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

UbjwOmnUpJCK9iP4qBxiWA.text: Oh the diamond. Probably one of the most consistent and reliable places around. Rarely ever do they have a wait. Whether you've been out drinking and are looking for a place to soak up the alcohol or are just looking for a place to get some good southern food the diamond has you covered. I usually come here for a Greek salad or a gyro. Service has always been great and has never slipped up on me once. Pretty decent beer selection available. This place is definitely a charlotte landmark and is a pretty cool looking building in general. Check it out

d7OX0vOLQqhfmudGDS-JKA.text: Diamond is a staple in Charlotte.  It's a classic diner with an old school feel.   The prices are very reasonable and the portions are big.  My go to is the pimento cheese sandwich with sweet potato fries.  The fries come in a huge basket for sharing. Their pimento cheese in general is amazinnngggg!    They have a variety of options for drinks. $5.00 mimosas on saturdays.  There is a patio out front to enjoy food and drinks as well.   A couple of tips: 1) As a warning  the parking lot is small and there isn't usually open spots. 2) Good to know is that they are open very late on the weekends so this is a good option instead of fast food!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sweet potato fries!

MxoFO6jCuQYEbGzAyY4UDg.text: This is a really cute restaurant on Commonwealth Avenue in Plaza Midwood. It has a retro design on the inside, dimly lit with a dining area inside and a counter/bar. The service was friendly, had no issues there. I tried the fried fish plate, and I felt like it was okay. I actually enjoyed the hush puppies that came with the dish more than the fish. The fries were good, for fries. I'm interested in going back and trying more things, but this first visit was ok.

WpTK1HPDYu9h4_VCz1M4cA.text: I've been to this restaurant multiple times and get the same thing every time. I get a cheeseburger southern style and the dinky winky dog. The homemade pimento cheese is my favorite. I get it on the burger and it comes on the dog. This is probably my fourth or fifth time coming here. Whenever I'm on this side of town, Ill definitely stop in and grab a bite or drink!! Great service too. Nice place, a little small but overall good!!

DuWAG9NNiQsd8l2yNyobjw.text: Diamond is solid but not spectacular in the southern kitchen style of cooking. It's hard to be spectacular in the genre because if a recipe gets taken too far to the edge, it isn't going to be authentic. But if it is authentic, it is bland and unhealthy. So Diamond has authentic southern food which typically will mean a meat and vegetables and Diamond is certainly acceptable. This is an old school place with a hipster vibe and some outdoor seating. A good place to get an inexpensive filling meal before hitting the Plaza Midwood nightlife but is not a destination dining place.

F6h0Olz_lNtmAlzZ4RGq6w.text: Pretty good food. Will definitely return. There have been times we didn't stop because of the amount of folks here.  Those times were around midnight! Very expansive menu with something for all.  Everything I saw leaving the kitchen looked appetizing. All the vegetables were fresh and hot. We're probably having burgers or wings next.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meatloaf, greens, squash. Fried okra, potatoes and gravy, Mac &amp; cheese  Biscuit and cornbread.

ywCOA46TuTrjscbiqmXllw.text: Local Noda diner set across the street from Legion Brewing. This place turned out to be perfectly located after friends and I spent a few hours at Legion. I can imagine Diamond gets a great deal of customers with all the local businesses in Noda.  I'm a big fan of local diners and this place hit all the right spots for a Saturday afternoon grub fest. Tuna Melt was perfectly cooked and the fries were traditional diner style. I really like the setup inside; it takes you back a few years.   I can see this place being pretty popular later at night and having the ability to quench a serious hunger craving. The menu is pretty traditional with burgers, sandwiches, and typical diner-style food. There is not a great deal of seating here but should be sufficient to accommodate most lunch crowds.

Uq-n5FnGsAShluZj8tnDYA.text: Cool atmosphere. The food is hit or miss. The collards are amazing. Good sweet potato fries.  The gravy fries were super unappetizing.  A sad substitute for poutine :(. The gravy fries we were served looked nothing like the photos on Yelp, so I think they've changed.  A lot of vegetarian options

NVKYFA5xtRWIj7B9StXRhg.text: We had a very nice time sitting outside. We enjoyed fried pickles. Just enough breading. I had the big block burger - all the way. Delicious. My wife had the pimento cheese sandwich and liked it.

4bRxJ78ygB0gfYO_vr78mw.text: Visited this little hidden gem on Sunday.  This is just a little eclectic diner with not a lot of seating but definitely worth the visit.  The Diamond Boy pork burger was awesome!  Not usually a big cole slaw lover but this vinegar based salad was very good.  Make sure to bring a coat in the winter....with the door opening and closing, it was quite chilly!

X3P5UlbVZu-Jkyc9Ishz-Q.text: I love the Diamond.  It's in a great location in Plaza Midwood, right on Commonwealth.  The outdoor patio is great when the weather is nice out and they are dog friendly so we bring our dogs with us a lot.  I'm a pescetarian and I can always find veggie options that are yummy here. The fried pickles are amazing as well as their veggie burger.  I also like that they serve breakfast all day.  I would highly recommend this place.  Since the whole debacle with the Penguin, we have been coming here and their food and location is just as good, if not better!

cyTqcePHA4HZZqZk2GAXAA.text: Really good diner food, and it's such a quirky fun atmosphere. They have a great patio outside for when the weather is nice and they don't mind dogs, which is really nice. I highly recommend the burgers!

vA7NDpTqrCOOS6sN8kMSwA.text: Great atmosphere, very laid back, friendly service, excellent food with more than generous portions.

mD1zrscu3QczwkakccF9AQ.text: Had hoped it to be much better but as a good food lover, this makes it no higher than the mediocre level.  Fried chicken was a little greasy and dry.  French fries no better taste or texture than a bag of frozen fries from the supermarket stuck in an oven. If these were actually fried at The Diamond then someone should be overseeing food prep. Maybe too many put in the fryer at once?   Corn muffin was inedible- stale and dry. Fried shrimp were very good, as the one bright spot. Also, service very capable and  friendly.  Maybe the burgers are great but I won't find out as I won't bother returning.

bcCDZCwZrUBiIk9MhwwlnQ.text: Gotta love the Diamond.   It's the first place that my wife and I tried when we moved to Charlotte; our first taste of the south.   And it was tasty. I remember ordering fried pickles for the first time, a cheerwine for the first time, along with fried chicken and fries. It was very satisfying. I've been back a few times since and it always hits the spot. It's a little greasy so I try not to make too many trips, but it's really good.   It's open late, has a fun crowd and although it's small it doesn't feel that small. I really like the vibe in here. It has a character of its own and I like it a lot. If you're in Charlotte, you've gotta try it!

G0c0nKDidUl3PzaF13KP8g.text: It use to be the place to go. Know it's 45mins-1hr to get to go food a 2hr sit down dinner. I didn't see that they got a five star rating, especially from the worn out decor and unsanitary restroom. Plaza midwood has a cool and hip vibe but it doesn't mean we want poor service from employees that are annoyed we are there and a unclean feel.

S80itQ2DFtnKrk9C9WXgIQ.text: A plaza midwood staple (changed ownership a few years back to those who used to work for the Penguin, I believe). Burgers are always on point, you have to order the sides separate though. Not bad actually because the basket sides are big enough to share. My family and friends have been coming here for years. Always love the fried pickles, I enjoy their hummus plate too.  We typically enjoy the meals but the service is usually a miss. Either takes too long to greet the table and then bring drinks or the servers don't come back for awhile to even take our order. Just recently I went in with my husband, starving a bit, and after bringing drinks our server never came back. I looked around and saw her SITTING in the back talking to another worker...that sucked 'cause I was damn hungry. Hostess acted annoyed when I said I was looking for our server 'cause we were ready to order. Like no big deal...but she's sitting over there and I'm being nice about it. Hopefully they'll make some changes since most of the reviews online are not 5 stars (says a lot). Still have love for The Diamond!

_Iohj6iKgQCD5ibmzXEtHg.text: I ordered take-out recently from The Diamond through Living Social. I was told my many Charlottians that this was the place for burgers in Charlotte; "the best!" Well, if the burger I was served is "the best in town" than I'm moving away.   I ordered the Diamond Boy burger, side of mac-n-cheese, and a drink. The order was off to a bad start when I had to return to the restaurant when I discovered thy didn't put the drink in the bag. Ok, no problem. Honest mistake. It was 6:30pm after all, dinner rush. Then I got to the burger.. patty was way over-done & bland. The onions didn't save the flavor on the burger either, not desirable at all.  I gave 2 stars because the place was packed and obviously I was in the minority getting a bad-burger; probably because I got take-out. The mac-n-cheese was also really good. Even still though, I'm not going back to The Diamond in the near future. Plenty of better choices.

56WLVfkOcO1YZtESXO3jGw.text: I will never recommend unless you yourself are  inebriated  ... Absolutely terrible service. I don't care if it's late night or not. It literally took three tries to get an order of French fries with pimento cheese... This took over 20 minutes (this was also supposed to be the Appetizer) after food was delivered we attempted to eat what we could, the waffle was undercooked, the burger burnt to a crisp... We ate what we could since we were hungry but it was not worth it. Starving actually sounds like a better option verses eating there: it took us 15 minutes to get our check from the moment we started to prebus our own table

Oe3R8SyYD1bym5wOvipfKw.text: You have to order their fried pickles as a starter. Some of the best in Charlotte. I really like their black bean burger, but I always order it with pimento cheese instead of cheddar. This is one of my favorite late night spots when I want to veer off of my diet!

atFN9skrnJA9oSs-MRgBTQ.text: We went here because someone said it had the best southern fried food, not by any means. I had the fried chicken and may have been the worst I've ever had. There was zero flavor other than the taste of onion rings that they must have fried next to it. It actually was pink and they did take it back and did not bill me, waitress was nice and noticed I wasn't eating. Here is the problem, I took a piece off with my fork which I was eating my sides with and put it back in the fryer. Just seems not sanitary. My husband had the chicken sandwich and he really liked it. Just was disappointed as it's by far not the best southern food by any means. It's also very warm in there on hot days.

IyDtbLSpAqEiXn0A3ue3tA.text: Read a lot of reviews, some great, some not so great. So me and my buddy decide to go check it out for ourselves. We go on a Saturday at 1:30pm, which I figured was a good time since it SHOULD be just after lunch. But not at the Diamond as it was wall to wall crowded!  So we get seated in under 10 minutes, and we both decide to get the burgers since it was our first time here. I've been in Charlotte 2 years now, and have had some pretty good burgers, but I wanted to see if this was "the mecca" for Burgers.   A week before, I decided to check out the Penguin and I admit that their Burgers were damn good! So I thought, No way can the Diamond's be any better. Boy was I wrong! I got the double and my buddy went for the Full Hemi (3 patties for a full pound)! We both ordered it Medium and they both came that way. Always worry about that especially when a Restaurant is super busy like the Diamond.  So bottom line - the Burgers were cooked to PERFECTION! Super juicy deliciousness (fatty beef content for FLAVOR) and their Fries were home cut and made quite well.   Oh, we started the meal with the Fried Pickles as my buddy never had a GOOD version of this dish. And man did we both love them! Crispy with good seasoning (some Cheyenne?) served with Ranch! Oh so yummy!  Back to the burgers.....so after asking for many additional Napkins (which is a GREAT sign at a burger joint because you know it's super juicy), we both stated out loud that this is the BEST BURGER IN CHARLOTTE! Penguin was a close second, only edged out by the Diamond because they cooked my burger to a PERFECT MEDIUM with a nice red/pink center.   So it's a 1 - 2 race, with the Diamond in a close lead!  Overall, a DELICIOUS lunch with a prompt and friendly staff, despite the crowd (another good sign when people literally line up out the door).  Can't wait to come back! If you're craving a GREAT burger, come here!  5 Star Rating is for their AWESOME Burger and Fries!

l-0V-wZyPTK9laZmtAsSGQ.text: Fried chicken is the bomb...good outdoor dining in a cool part of town. Now that The Penguin is gone, this is the place to eat.

PZp_4QXkOIGHccaJjDZc2Q.text: I've been to the Diamond on many occasions, so when my parents came into town from out-of-state, I had to make sure they tried out the best diner food in Plaza-Midwood. We arrived around 1pm around the end of the lunch rush but there was no wait and we were directed to our table by a staff member. It took our server a moment to come over to our table, but the place was busy and it gave us a chance to settle in and review the menu.  When our server came over to the table she was more professional than friendly, though she may have just been in a hurry. She was quite knowledgeable about the menu and was able to answer all my parents' questions about several items. My father is sensitive to caffeine and can't have many sodas, so our server offered to make a fresh pot of decaf coffee for him - extra kudos to her for the effort.  We finally settled on our order, which took only a few minutes - great ticket times from the kitchen. I had the BLT with a side of green beans, and my parents ordered the Marinated Chicken Tips and the Salmon Patties.  I love the Diamond's BLTs for one reason - they don't skimp on the bacon! My sandwich is always a crispy, crunchy mass of bacon. The only complaint I have about the BLT is the sandwich bread is a little thin and doesn't hold up well, but it still tastes delicious. Both my parents were quite happy with their meals and we decided to order dessert.  My father and I ordered the Pecan Pie, my favorite, but they were out... We accepted banana pudding instead and my mother had the Chocolate Delight. The banana pudding was a decent alternative: it was very creamy and whatever wafers had been used in the recipe had disintegrated into mushy goodness.  A little bit of a let-down there, I like a little crunch to offset the pudding, but I'm a little picky.   The waitress brought us our bill in a timely manner and even recommended a couple of local events occurring in the neighborhood that were in walking distance. All-in-all, it was a decent meal, but I was disappointed they didn't have the Pecan Pie. I'll definitely be back to try and get some pie.

MD-uAPXg1I0ji3LDG_3UEQ.text: Ate there tonight for the first time.  I do have to say the prices are very fair.  The service staff is very "alternative"  Lots of tats, bull nose rings, big hole ear stretch earnings, I don't mind alternative but hygiene has to be there and I felt it wasn't.  They were out of about seven menu items and the service was very slow and lacked any genuine hospitality.  I'll give it one more shot because several friends of mine rave about the place but I was not impressed with my first visit.

N9FEzQCjRmSM0xbQe7gBCA.text: Just a good old fashioned mom and pop type restaurant definitely a stop and eat place that many of my friends and family visit frequent occasion

HycDsJoozUoeszJQUgU1yQ.text: Tried their "chicken-pot-pie" last week and it was a real disappointment. For $8 you expect more than something out of a Campbells soup can poured into a dish and covered with crust. Did not even include a side dish with the meal. Crust was the only part worth eating.  Disappointing since this place used to serve quality food all the time.

LTiiebUw61BiMOuQSN6wWA.text: So disappointed. Diamond used to be one of my favorite places to grab a bite to eat but it has fallen off badly. Stopped by last night for dinner in hopes of a good experience. (I actually was giving them another chance after previous less than stellar dining that I've experienced with them recently.) Firstly the waitress was pleasant but not the most attentive, which I'm not sure why bc they weren't that busy. Secondly, I ordered the gravy fries as an appetizer, and the fries were over cooked, not salted at all and the gravy was bland. No worries though, bc I was looking forward to my usual Small block burger and hot dog. To my disappointment, my burger was also extremely over cooked and dry. The hot dog was ok but the chili was a bit salty. My fiance had the salmon which he said wasn't bad, but he also was served burnt fries. He sent them back in exchange for hush puppies which I couldn't believe also came out Burnt and hard as a rock! He ended up sending them back as well. The waitress seemed surprised that we had the audacity to not want burnt food. I couldn't believe it. Not sure if they have different management or new cooks who don't know how to time food. Because of the over cooked bland food and poor customer service I will be unfortunately be saying Adieu to Diamond.

K1uSa-NScieDA5QbUOZkCw.text: Great food and a very unique menu but I have to give two stars based off our horrific service we received last week during lunch. We had friends from CA in town and wanted to show them a town favorite in our neighborhood. Service took over an hour and a half, waiter seemed apathetic, and when we would call out to other waitresses/waiters for some help, we were brushed off. Will try again though bc I enjoyed my tuna melt sandwich and fried pickles.

mzKAkuu2Wlw-ghhmUoclVQ.text: My most recent visit to Diamond was before the dinner rush hour. Service was quick and our food arrived hot and fresh. The restaurant was quiet which we appreciated during our early dinner before a show. I ordered the Dixie Chicken sandwich, chicken breast on a bun with lettuce and tomato. We were in a rush so I only ate half of it but it was well prepared and delicious. I was delighted the chicken was cooked well and not dried out. Diamond is within walking distance of many other shops and restaurants located along Central Avenue. The restaurant is old, but the food is good.

jgHsW684RrI1ZqxATERnNw.text: One of the best places I've eaten at since i moved to Charlotte. Great service, better food. Plus they have vegan options

CzMPo501TacfbGtWgflkfw.text: The diamond is such a great place. We came for dinner on a busy day and the food did take awhile to arrive. Nevertheless the food is great as I ordered a diamond dog which is a 12 inch hot dog with chili, onion, and mustard. I also ordered a side of Mac and cheese which was delightful. The server however did forget my drink and the food was delayed but I do realize it was busy. So will be back again and hope for a better experience next go around.

GU7R0wCEEIc66O-lhGyeOg.text: This place exists for late night drunk food (I should've known when I saw it was open until 3am). It's a diner in the heart of Plaza Midwood with both indoor and outdoor seating. They have quite a large menu with everything from fried pickles to Greek food to seafood to hotdogs and burgers. The service is a little on the slower side, but they were friendly enough. The food tasted like food only someone whose judgement was impaired would like. The fried pickles were so over fried that the actual pickle on the instead was kind of crispy. The diamond hot dog was also kind of rubbery and the bun was toasted to help mask it being stale. Before I even left, my stomach was angry and doing flips.

aRs7RHaXkpnlltRXZyhQYg.text: At first, I was "iffy" about coming inside because the outside looked different than what I'm use to. The inside looks like a old dinner but very clean. I had the jumbo party wings and my husband had race dogs. The food was REALLY good.  I definitely will be back to try more of their menus options. You should give it a try! Don't judge a book by its cover.

wfhFzXHR9O0bUodedR73FQ.text: I want this place to be better than it is. It has the all the makings of a great establishment: affordable food, friendly staff, cool and laid-back diner atmosphere. But they fall short when it comes to the actual food. I got the pimento grilled cheese and it was disappointing. The cheese itself tasted great but it was cold and wasn't even melted. A requirement of any grilled cheese sandwich! Could have been an off day and maybe other items on the menu are better but I left feeling sad. Hopefully they improve.

BrJUCcyeNCI5vrUbdhtzcg.text: My experience with them has been mediocre. The food is ok and the service is also "ok". The wait staff can be a little rude sometimes and the food is a little on the bland side but Not the rudest staff or the worst food that I've ever encountered though. The banana pudding is bomb though. If you don't have high expectations and are looking for a place to have an average work lunch this place will do it.

WaMfPSaHbYaK39JCdgHH1w.text: Good old diner unique options. I had the lamb stuffed po"boy it was very tasty but a little shocked it came on a hamburger bun. Kinda expected a hogie roll or pita. Aside from that it was very good.

smnasiMO5tNDvO66KW1lAg.text: First, the pros - great vibe, great atmosphere. Funky little place. The chicken parmigiana hot sub sandwich was pretty good.  Unfortunately the cons outweighed the good stuff. The wait was atrocious! Very long time for a sandwich and burger. The "diamond boy" was over cooked and tasteless. The blue cheese dressing was thin with no actual boy cheese in it.   I really wanted to like this place.

pBkNlpR8kNn748mJVTmeYQ.text: Burgers are good but don't get the fruit cup. It looks and tastes like they went to a Ponderosa buffet and scooped out some fruit after its been siting out for 12 hours at room temperate. Nasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Food- nasty fruit

7qZjBJwQ16I2HQuvUJupUg.text: I want to give 3.5 stars but decided to round up instead of down. As far as diners go this place is pretty unique and cute. I love that they have a full bar! Such a cool idea. That alone warranted 3 stars in my book . We came just after Christmas so it was still decorated in little lights which I loved, they should just keep them all year round! Lol.   The building itself is small, the booths are smaller than usual and everything is packed in pretty tight. The parking is not the best, it's not a paved parking lot it's bumpy and all over the place.   Prices are great, very reasonable. Fun diner music playing. For as small as it is I actually liked the look of it. The staff do not wear uniforms, they are all in regular street clothes. Which is fine except when I walked in I couldn't tell who were the workers and who weren't. Very casual kinda place.   Now for the food. We came here for one reason only: the Midwood challenge. My husband found out about it and just had to take the challenge to get a free shirt.  it's a giant sandwich with 2lbs alone just in meat. Plus fries and coleslaw on the side and you have to finish it all. I seriously thought my husband was going to die, I don't recommend for anyone to do this.   The food quality itself it wasn't that great. The Midwood challenge sandwich that he and his brother got was pretty much lunch meat you can buy in the grocery store and put on a bun. Tasted like something you can make at home. I had the hot dog with chili and pimento cheese. It was pretty good, the dog itself tasted like it was all beef and it had kinda a Smokey flavor to it. The chili was bean less which is the only way I like it. I also had a side of homemade potato chips with pimento cheese dip. Sooo much cheese. The chips were really good, thin and crunchy.   Overall good diner, not high quality food but a good bang for your buck with reasonable prices. If I lived here I would visit again but mainly because of the bar in it .

K8STkk6ZwfCorCmGG6jDAA.text: The food was soooooo amazing... I had the pork chops with macaroni and cheese with collard greens I loved the laid back atmosphere and our waitress was very nice

FcpfL1PzJnzUzLUnkHundQ.text: Been a long time since I was here but today was a big disappointment.  Probably been at least seven years since I have been here but it was one of two places in Plaza Midwood that I liked. The other was the Penguin which closed last year.  Both were Charlotte Institutions and places to go late night for a late dinner. Both were good diners with National Reputations. and always had good food.  Have a list of places I want to try but with Road Construction, two were eliminated quickly and will have to get at a later day so i settled on Diamond.  Walked in and was seated shortly thereafter in a nice booth. Server was there to give me a menu and take my drink order.    Looking over the menu, I was in luck. There Seafood was one of my favorites, a Fried Oyster Plate. Ordered that with the Vinegar Slaw etc and pulled out the smartphone to check the latest headlines.  About two minutes later, the server showed up with a menu and informed me they were out of oysters and I needed to try again.,  Decided on the 1/2 Fried Chicken and upgraded to all white with sliced tomatoes and Fried Okra with a biscuit as my side.  I was shocked how quick the order came out. If it was made from scratch, one of the fastest turn arounds of an order. Either that of I last track on time which is possible.  Nice presentation.   However the food did not measure up to the presentation.   I knew to start with, I was taking a chance on the Sliced Tomatoes but there are still some Vine Ripened Tomatoes that taste like real tomatoes rather than flat. These had no real tomato taste to them at all.  The Okra was good and that brings us to the Chicken.  There were four pieces of Chicken One was a breast and one was a wing and I know they consider a wing to be white meat ( I don't) but the other two pieces were a drumstick and a back.  Have never seen backs and legs considered as white meat.  Chicken was very bland. The Drumstick was under cooked next to the bone. The other pieces were OK but very bland and the batter that they were covered with had no distinct taste at all.  At least they could have used the traditional Southern Seasoning of Salt and Pepper in with the flour but I could taste one of that.  Another catch at the end. When my check arrived, I looked at it and immediately register a look of shock. Total Bill was almost $28 dollars and I knew it should be closer to $14 - $15.  Server saw  my shock and we both took a look at the bill and the Oysters they were out of were still on the bill.  It was promptly removed.  Service was OK, atmosphere somewhat of a Dive but it was for years and that leads to the charm of the place but the food preparation leaves much to be desired.

bCFZuS6Q9KZOd8Y9zCTrNA.text: Food is usually good but the service can be very slow.  Most times the servers are friendly but I have gotten slow service and been treated rudely by the bar staff.  It can be hit or miss.  Good luck.

uoc8vUcahruGP3-kiJKEOw.text: This was... let's just say interesting. A big group of friends and I (I believe like 8-9 people total) came to The Diamond Restaurant for a late dinner on a Saturday night. There was quite a wait so we decided to get shots and drinks at the bar. Let me preface by saying that we were not drunk wasted folks. We hadn't had anything to drink during the night and since there was a wait, we decided to indulge in a few. The first thing that caught my attention was the staff. They weren't very friendly and honestly seemed annoyed by everyone in our party the entire time we were in the building. After waiting about forty minutes or so, we eventually got to our table and the weird attitude continued with our server. We were enjoying our time with each other so it didn't put a damper on our time. But I certainly picked up on it and it was uncomfortable.  When it came time to order, I got a black bean veggie burger with sweet potato fries. It came with spicy mayo, pepper jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions. The sweet potato fries were my favorite. They came with a side of honey mustard and I finished more of the fries than my veggie burger. The burger wasn't bad at all. I would order it again, the fries were just stellar and I couldn't stop eating them! The table also ordered a few appetizers. I tried the hot pimento cheese dip and the classic fried pickles. The cheese dip came with an assortment of crackers and the pickles came with a side of ranch. Both were good for me but I saved most of my appetite for my entree.   I'm not sure what happened with the service that night but the food was pretty good and the kitchen was on top of things. It was nice that we weren't left waiting forever for our food after a long wait for our table. If I find myself back in Charlotte I may be up for giving the service at The Diamond Restaurant another chance but I won't be jumping for the opportunity.

noJ9gc53wYr6RMsqlHiIKA.text: I have been here a few times and they haven't been great experiences but not the worst.  Tonight was a total bad one probably the worst. I stopped by around 2:30 and went inside from the rain only to have the lady inside tell me they were closed when their business hours clearly say 3am.  I really don't get why businesses post a specific closing time but don't honor their times.  If you don't want people coming in then say what time you really intend to close like 2:30 not 3.  It's super annoying because now I've already wasted 15 minutes of my life that I'll never get back because your business posts business hours of 3am and you decide that you aren't honoring those business hours.  They also switched to a late night menu whereas before they used to have a full menu before.  I'm not sure who is making alot of these changes here but someone needs to check themselves because this is not how you do business.  I'm not sure if I'll ever return or recommend this business to anyone else because of these experiences either.

2b34-Kbz73PATIDbzwiKlA.text: Reverse angle parking. Still dumb. Still refuse to do it. I'll walk here if I have to or roll the dice and hope there's a spot in their tiny parking lot.   The Diamond is a True Charlotte institution. One part old school diner, one part dive. All parts badass.   If you can't find something you like on this menu, well the problem maybe you then. There's a little bit of everything. You'll find some of the best fried pickles in the city here. Among my favs: pig wings (deep fried pork shanks, get 'em. You're welcome), gravy fries (make sure to get pimento as well), onion rings, small block burger (add cheese, all the way), pork chops, meatless loaf (and I'm not a vegetarian), and the Dixie chicken sandwich. They also have homemade desserts and a full service bar. Choose those extra calories wisely.   I love to sit on the patio here and people watch. Plaza Midwood, don't ever change. This is a great spot to grab some grub before (or after) hitting up Legion Brewery which is right across the street.

Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gravy fries
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

_l3bHo5M6SizZfyKpxww2w.text: Diamond gets most everything right about a 21st-century diner experience.  Diamond was apparently a neighborhood fixture that dated back to the 1940s, but closed in 2010.  Now, I don't live in Charlotte and only started visiting in recent years after my brother moved to town, but I'm going to take a wild guess that, back in the old days, Diamond had plenty of evocative old diner atmosphere but a boring, tired menu.  (Somebody correct me if I'm wrong.)  The present-day Diamond obviously retains the bones and fixtures of the old diner but it's been overhauled and retrofitted for modern tastes.  It's almost like a diner production-designed to evoke some movie roadhouse rockabilly diner of old, but which never actually existed until the last 15-20 years:  Regular diner fixtures, but darker colors that suggest a bunker-like barroom, neon lights, what looks like a full bar, rock and roll on the sound system.  At lunchtime, it's pretty evocative--although I could see it getting obnoxious late at night--and I like it.  I imagine that the menu was overhauled, too.  There is still a long, long list of diner and Southern standards, but there are also a few nods to the current century and to the existence of vegetarians:  black bean burgers, black bean hummus, a meze platter, a "meatless loaf."  I went with fried chicken, black eyed peas, and collards.  In my town of Cincinnati, just about the only two places other than chains to get fried chicken is an ultra-yuppie place and a kinda-expensive place that caters mainly to senior citizens and even the seniors' parents.  Diamond's fried chicken was only pretty good, but the veggies were boldly flavored and cooked perfectly.  (Vegetable plate sounds like a good idea, but oddly enough, getting it doesn't save you any money.)  Prices are very fair, and the iced tea was done right.

kBW_5lqH-eEeHroTAmYZwA.text: Come here every now and then. The service is hit or miss, but the food is your typical diner food. The fried pickles are a MUST! And I usually opt for the burger with fries, while my husband switches it up every time he orders. It is close to where we live, and it is open late - both pretty good perks for us. Park can get tough at times, especially on the weekends but what can you expect? It is plaza.

dJ-kw6gHLOYgrs_w-_IX1A.text: Funky little diner-ish place conveniently located near Legion!  Great service and the food was pretty good. Full bar and local beer on tap.  It must be an interesting place to be very late at night on weekends.  Dan liked the salmon cakes and the menagerie of southern sides. The gyro platter was massive! Crinkle cut fries.

SEce8ZH1JKEUm57vhd3WTg.text: All I can say is Awesome Comfort Food.  I have come for lunch and dinner and I have never been disappointed with my order.  Mostly order in but I have also ordered to go.  Always the same great taste and comes out hot.  Favorite Drink: Midwood Mule  I randomly decided to go Italian one day and get the chicken parm dish... It was so good I now mostly order that.  Friendly staff and comfortable/nostalgic diner setting.  Also they have an outdoor seating area; great to sit out on summer nights and you can bring your dog.

wIkV3M9LgwjPB_fzYPAImA.text: Judging by the reviews I thought I was in for a delicious treat. Not at all. The fries were not fried right, the gravy on the fries was bland. The first burger attempted to be delivered was not what we ordered at all. The delivered burger was also bland. Not the place for a good burger and fries.

jp2qDWenNyL-POe4fyDcag.text: The food isn't bad. I'm obsessed with sweet potato fries, so I try every place her in Charlotte. These are great! I love the BLT, the bacon isn't too fatty & cooked perfectly. But the blonde bartender is a major bitch! I hate placing my to go order when I see her. She gives no eye contact, talks to you while doing other things or walking away & just sits your money down without even seeing if there's anything else we need. Happens every time, like it's rehearsed lmao. Food is still amazing tho =)

0hxInQjX5kceuEQo9gZyGA.text: If I could give zero stars, I would, due to this really disappointing experience. For a Sunday lunch, we were at the restaurant for 3 hours including our wait/dining. To start, our waitress Jude was rude and would only briefly flit by our table. One of our entrees didn't come out for an additional 30 minutes, one meal was missing a biscuit (Jude said they were made fresh, hence the wait. Too bad the biscuit NEVER showed up), we had to ask multiple times for drinks, silverware wasn't delivered until we asked for it after our entrees were delivered, amidst a myriad of other problems. Jude's poor service was accompanied by a terrible attitude when we expressed our complaints, most of which she blamed on the kitchen for a variety of reasons. The food was disappointing as well. Definitely will not be returning.

egKKCN3TZYz5rZFdxA4KYA.text: Not happy  waitress was told we need a highchair   Did about 10 things  gave the chair to another huest who came in 10 min after us and was rude the rest of the time barley came to check on us

iz_mpD_MjHjGcKA6LLl81Q.text: Amazing burgers.  Down home southern feel.  Cold draft beers.  A Charlotte hotspot.    Big Block Burger (Two 1/3 lb. patties) all-the-way with a Yuengling draft.  Mmm, that's whachya do, right there...

PYP6bV6wwpYdrIYzaKtrYg.text: Ive been to Diamond on several occasions. I love when they have drink specials ~ pickle backs are something Ive come to enjoy thanks to a special.  The fried pickles are awesome and so are the hush puppies (both artery clogging, I know, but I cant help myself :).  However, today I discovered two items ill never order again: the creamed squash and the Veggie Meatloaf. Im a vegetarian and have had this type of dish at Letties, which is around the corner on Shamrock -- and they do Veggie Meatloaf really well...so Diamonds paled terribly in comparison. Diamonds Veggie loaf is too dry and absolutely too large, unseasoned, and over breadcrumbed. The squash was swimming in cream, as though it hadnt even been cooked...so that was gross.  However, Ive never been disappointed with the mac and cheese OR the black bean burger. Next time I go, Ill stick to what I know.   3 stars because there are some great staples on the menu.

Kz0CwCm7WBg-DF1_PIeGVQ.text: The wallpaper. I have to start with the wallpaper. I want it. I love it.   The fried pickles are perfectly crunchy, not spears (chips!) and not soggy (well, you have to eat them right after ordering them but that is part of the magic of a fried pickle). The hamburgers aren't fancy best, but they are definitely good (especially with pimento cheese). They won't ask you how to cook the meat. But that is okay. You aren't at the diamond for that sort of burger.  The Greek salad is a nice option (you know, when you are feeling healthy).   If it looks super busy- don't stress. The wait is rarely long. I love the new patio.   THE WALLPAPER, Y'ALL. I love it.

aZEOw9h9534tniOzjF-ZCQ.text: Absolutely loved the decor and jukebox. We got a table quickly and service was fast and friendly. The fried pickles are amazing! I ordered the meatless loaf, which was good (maybe a bit on the dry side). The side dishes were fabulous - mashed potatoes and gravy, brocolli salad, & cornbread. Two of my dining partners had the burgers and raved about them, one had the fried chicken and also loved it. The portions were HUGE and the price was exceptionally good. Also, great selection for vegetarians!   I'll be back next time I'm in town for sure.

0vUj-_4f-S6yLcn6kzkThQ.text: Snuck in here for some dinner last night, and it was all I had hoped for. And more. Flawlessly redone, lots of familiar faces, perfect.  The smell of fresh vinyl's a teeny bit overwhelming, but soon, it'll be taken over by the sweet aroma of clogged arteries. Fried pickles, burgers, and dogs are here, but the menu expands - and there's some eggplant parm, some greek stuffs, even a sizable salad section. Guess what, my vegan darlings? There's a meatloaf-style dinner here, and you can eat it. I did, and it was carroty, savory, lots of thyme. Lovely.  But I already know what I'll be ordering every time I step foot in here after a number of beers - Poutine. Because it's here, all pimento-cheese-encrusted, choice of veg or meat gravy, and good lord in heaven, it is friggin' awesome.  Officially open later in the week. And forever mobbed after that.

MN9d_tD-X4v5S6izU-IFyA.text: My wife and I were playing tourists in Charlotte over the Labor Day weekend. We watched the Burger Land episode (on Travel Channel) several weeks prior and remembered this place. We promised ourselves we'd stop in and glad we did!  We came in around 12:30pm on Sunday September 1st. It was so packed we sat at the counter. Of course we got the burgers. Mine was the "Big Block" Southern style (chili mustard, onions, & coleslaw) for $6.95, and hers was the "Small Block" for $3.95. I ended up having to make it a fork-and-knife burger for the top half fell over. For a burger that good, it doesn't matter how I eat it! We split the sweet potato fries ($3.95) and there were plenty too.  We hope to be back for we are Panthers fans!

4H1UNwZqVRefbqrvk4y-0g.text: Finally got around to trying out the new Diamond. Monday evening 7pm, less than 10 min wait, hurrah. Seated in corner, kind of weird spot, whatevs, I was starved. Friendly waitress was quick and took our orders promptly. Got my go to, the soy veggie dog. It was just as delicious as I remembered it to be. I can be happy again.   Bar is nice and wonderful to grab a quick, cheap beer before having to run off, to the next bar or from whoever's chasing you.  Expanded menu includes all our old favorites plus a couple extras, everything looks delicious. Will have to bring stretchy pants next time.

7z0bS2zqar3W1akojxLgjg.text: Don't really need to throw in another "Oh, how the Penguin was oh-so grandiose back in my day blah blah blah" kind of story with ties to the Diamond. The Diamond is your typical greasy spoons kinda place with all of the fried fare your body can handle for a heavy lunch, late-night bender, or overt pig out.   Keep True to my favorites of old, the Small Block -- Southern Style is my go-to. The chili and slaw atop a nice, flattop burger sings happy tunes to the greasy glands in my brain. Crinkle cut fries round it out to really make you hate and love yourself at the same time, too.   Love the feel of this spot. The layout feels weirder and weirder upon every visit. Not too many seats to fight over in this joint. Waits can get a little lengthy, but most people are in and out while keeping popularity in mind.   Count me in as part of the Diamond fan club.

YwnsdI1e5QyPlNx9KQ-MBA.text: Get the hamburger steak! And the small block southern style! Great comfort food, nice service, very popular! Hip spot, locals always rate it tops. This is our second visit here and we sought it out purposefully! Love The Diamond!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate cake and nanner puddin- amazing desserts!
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hamburger steak and southern style small block burger!

7Dwg4tVDzJFMOEUPQAyEtg.text: I think this is 4 stars for me and not 5 because it was so hyped up. The best way I can describe the burger I had (full block with bacon and cheese all the way) was a cross between 5 guys and Wendy's. That's a damn good compliment in my book since I love both of those spots.   I got a side of sweet potato fries to go along which were great.  Next time I'm going 2 burgers though because frankly just one full block didn't do it for me. Then again, my burger craving has been off the charts as of late.  Overal, great neighborhood joint, great burgers, friendly people, my kind of divey type of joint. Excited to get back.

yOVN9Vk9QcmtTRWfpHMRSQ.text: Tried this place with friends the other night.  There was a bit of a wait, but man it was worth it.  The timing worked out great since my friends were running a tad late.  They got there just in time to sit down.  The service was friendly and the food definitely blew me away.  I've seen this place before, but haven't tried it until now.  Looks like they have re-done the inside at some point and the outside porch awning was brand spanking new... and there were some construction contractors on the  top roof unloading materials when we arrived.  Anyways... onto the food!  The menu definitely have some unique things going for it.  I ended up choosing a vegetarian dish:  Meatless Loaf and Soy Milk Mash.... came with 2 sides of which I chose the sweet potato fries and hush puppies....  After I ordered, I realized I could have gotten more veggies, but I was happy with what I got.  The loaf was amazing... we sat there trying to figure out what was in it... but man, I could have sworn there was some sort of meat in there.  I did order the pig wings for the table, which were AMAZING... our server said it comes with (5) pig wings, but we ended up getting (6)... I guess the extra wink I gave to our waiter paid off (or probably not).  Definitely will come back to try their other menu items.  But I'm considering the Diamond a very bright spot for the Charlotte food scene.

UxLK_yb6KzGxqJgifYGqzA.text: I'm not going to lie, I'm a little disappointed in this place. I was always a fan of The Penguin, then once it changed owners my love went to Pinky's. The Diamond has similar stuff like Pinky's, but just doesn't get there. We first arrived on a Saturday around noon and we were seated immediately. Our server was fast and attentive (which is why I'm giving this place three stars instead of two). Our food came out pretty fast and I appreciated them making sure my two little girls got their food first. As a parent it makes my trip much easier when the kids eat first so they're not squirming around. I got them both a veggie plate which is a great option for picky kids. You can pick two sides for each plate, and both kids enjoyed it. We got fried pickles which is just like Pinky's and were fantastic as always. I ordered the Dixie chicken sandwich and was let down. The chicken didn't have enough flavor for being fried. I was hoping it would have more of a kick or something. It was a massive sandwich though, and had to take home the rest. I tried the pimento cheese fries and was completely disappointed. It had hardly any cheese flavor to it, and I could only really taste the pimento if anything. My husband ordered salmon patties with hush puppies and green beans with a biscuit. He said everything was pretty bland and was disappointed as well. Once he found out our bill topped $50 he definitely wasn't leaving happy. Considering how much the food is for the quality of it, I won't be returning here again. I suggest you skip this place and just go to Pinky's. You'll be much happier there.

tUZLUvj__XVz2DYQY6qFZw.text: Came in to pick up a to-go order, and wasn't greeted by one employee. Tatted up female bartender was stoic. Her bf came in and only made poor service worse by permanently distracting her.  I had to yell "excuse me" for what felt like forever to some guy to hand me my ready order that was just sitting behind the bar.

Ta3njLYM2eBODKm2zVI8hA.text: As a very picky late eater, Diamonds always comes to mind if I want to take a night off from cooking.   I normally order the fried shrimp (awesome; seasoned and crispy), collard greens, and sliced tomatoes. My second choice is their fried pork chop and (awesome) mac and cheese.  Please note that after 9pm they stop serving the warm side items.   I would highly recommend this place. Food and location are great!  Only reason I gave this a 4 star instead of 5 is that on 2/15 times I have been, there were flies flying everywhere inside.

jrZNpu-xH_EuXOcUw0rTuw.text: This is my first time here and first time review. :D  I am vegetarian, so there wasn't many options, but I am used to that. They had a vegan/vegetarian meatloaf.....I though I died and went to heaven. It was to die for. SO GOOD. I don't know if I can go back there and not get this meatloaf. I think meat-eaters would love this too.  I love the decor of the place, the feeling, and the atmosphere. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was because of the slow service. They just need to have an extra server on the weekends. Two servers are just not enough for inside and outside seating.   *Just to mention: OUR SERVER WAS AMAZING!!!!

OXguJOvnBVeijqzuFbo1HQ.text: Wow this place has gone downhill. I don't have high expectations for a diner. But I do want quality food served fast. Walked in with a buddy at 8:30 on a Friday night. They were busy, but we were seated immediately. That was the high point of the night. Waitress approached after about 5 minutes to take our drink order. We ordered the fried pickles at the same time as our drinks because we were starving. Pickles came out about 20 minutes later. How long does it take to fry some damn pickles?!? Seriously. Waitress didn't take our order until we were halfway done with the pickles. I ordered the cheesesteak and my buddy ordered the fried flounder sandwich. Then we waited. And waited. 30 minutes later the waitress comes to our table and says our food is up next. Meanwhile tables who were seated after us were already eating. Finally our food arrives around 9:30....1 HOUR after we sat down. My cheesesteak tasted like it had been sitting on the griddle for a while. Plus it was full of fat and gristle. Pretty much got the impression the kitchen forgot about our food. We ate because we were hungry, but I will not be back. With so many other options in Charlotte, I'm not wasting my time here.

thDTxZwVF08ax3oJzMuEsA.text: This is an old stand-by for our family. Love the salmon BLT with fries swapped out for collards with an OMB Copper to wash it all down. Love the atmosphere and the diverse clientele. Great place to take the kids as well. The Diamond picks up right where the Penguin left off.

ZKD-QaHaayx4kqbRi4GoOw.text: Great place!  I think it's run by the previous Penquin staff ?....I go for the burgers, especially the veggie burger and I'm not even a vegan I just think it taste great.  They have lots of daily fresh made specials.  The sweet potato fries are great.  Good beer selection.  Diverse crowd from hipsters, locals and all in between.

AbCFz-SHEMmxjnTnBEANfA.text: Excellent all the way around!  Great food at inexpensive prices.  The small block burger is my favorite.  Great severs and quick service topped off with a very comfortable atmosphere.  Appropriately named The Diamond.

LvHGBfPzos32yNpnUwElwQ.text: The Diamond, oh how I waited for this place to open since the Penguin ownership fiasco. I was here on opening day and I wasn't disappointed. The fried pickles were just as good as the Penguin was, of course with a good ol' Big Block burger with bacon, cheese, and mayo. The service is good and my drink stays full. Portion sizes are worth the price. Only real negative keeping Diamond from a 5 review is the location and parking. If you're from out of town and trying to find it, you will pass by or miss the street it is on. The parking is either in the 6-10 spots at the business, on the street, or in the back lot. If you go here during lunch hours, or prime dinner hours expect a line and a wait.   Food is great, great atmosphere, and service is great. A well deserved 4

jid6WRWpuG5MXxhnQvkXRw.text: The Diamond Lives!  [Re]Opened Friday Ate on Saturday Delicious Big Block Burger Crispy Fried Pickles (w/o the side of fry oil you used to get) Gravy fries!  Thank you. I don't really care if they cater to picky vegans or not. Welcome back, old friend!
