p7egRWbr5PJYDAzVmYrQVA.text: Food was decent but I waited 50 minutes for a grilled cheese sandwich! Everyone around us got their food before us even though they were sat long after. Also, the waitress never refilled my drink after asking if I wanted more and me saying 'yes'. At least they were semi apologetic about how long we had to wait.

7OGr26axRZByE1Ugdt7fpQ.text: After  reading the Yelp reviews, I went to Diamond around 3pm in the afternoon for a "snack". They had a surprisingly sophisticated drink menu so I ordered a bloody mary made with their house mix, absolut vodka and topped with pickled vegetables.  As I am watching the bartender make the bloody mary, she puts the cheapest vodka in the glass and then precedes to pour a mix over it which had a terrible color!  I love a good bloody mary.  This bloody mary was no bueno - cheap vodka, crappy mix and no pickled vegetables.  On to the food - I ordered wings and fried pickles.  The fried pickles were good - the wings were not.  They were chewy, not spicy and dry.  Fast forward 3 hour and I feel terrible - in fact, I am in and out of the bathroom for a good 2 hours.  NEVER AGAIN.  If you're looking for good, cheap, greasy food try Pinky's!

n1euHGdc2-JrPt4FSogk2Q.text: We got the fried pickles, fried oysters, and Caesar salad and it was all good. The customer service was terrible. There is a saying that the south moves a bit slower, but in our experience they moved slower and don't care.

DtQRFSQ_UnfjZg9BwktPlg.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat in Charlotte, although I don't get there as often as I would like. My favorite is the steak sandwich and substitute fries (which are good, I just steal someone else's) with mac & cheese. The service is great, and also they serve Cheerwine and RC Cola in glass bottles. SO GOOD! I will return, hopefully soon.

GEswWPItE2BEKCFEilx5Qg.text: I am convinced with the mediocre food and service that this place is one of those places people say is amazing so they will appear cool.  I have been 3 times and have been let down 3 times.  My hotdog had a cool center.  Really?  If the server actually brings the entire tables food without forgetting someone, it would be an accomplishment.  If you want to be seen in a neo-hipster setting then this is your place.  Not sure if food is the real destination.

yj3U_XjiwQxuF6jrc9g5bw.text: Finally I got to say the words 'small block all the way with cheese please' and be satisfied completely again....sigh....it is as if the whole Penguin ownership fighting disaster was just a bad dream.  I didn't try the fried pickles to see if they were up to par like the old Penguin but the burger was DEFINITELY deja vu.  The inside of the restaurant is bigger than I thought it would be and the vibe similar if not the same.  Love you Diamond!  You will be my Charlotte staple for many happy small block years to come....

p2dkDUGLHG17CWneQFw0vw.text: I came here after a show to have some grub! We got in at 11:55pm - just 5 minutes before the kitchen closed. I got the double burger southern style and my friend got the pimento cheese sandwich with onion rings. Man it was all GREAT. The food is 5 star grub food but the inside is 3 stars only (floors are kind of slippery with grease). Still an overall 4 star rating - the server rocked it!! I WILL BE BACK!

iwduaDGmUY_iDo_5-yDESQ.text: the atmosphere, homemade vegetables, and drink specials sealed the deal for me.  the cornbread not so much, could use some more salt and flavor.

w_hW-Tz1htkZvw6BfUI3Cg.text: Neat place, decore retro but a bit dusty.  Service was fast but not overly friendly.  There were 2 of us, one had the fried bologna which could have been better.  The meat was thin cut and not high quality.  Tasted like the standard multi meat bland loaf that is cheap.  Friend had double burger which was good.  Plan to split an order of fries, one order is huge.  All in all not bad but could use some polishing (and dusting (esp the retro lamp in the center of the ceiling)

KnvwtDGQskxSSEtb6vnkeg.text: So I recently went back for food... It was... Awesome. I've heard good and bad coming from here so wasn't sure what to expect. I had the BLT which I've never been a big fan of (I ordered it because I wasn't that hungry), let's just say I am a fan now =)  My friend had a huge burger, can't recall the name of it, well, he's quite the burger lover and said it's the best he's had in a while. We also split a side of fries between the 2 of which we practically fought to the death over cause they were soooo darn good! Just fries right? Eh! Wrong! Sometimes they're over or undercooked, these were literally cooked to utter perfection. I've been dreaming of the BLT w/ fries from here ever since.   First time going that I actually sat on a table... Service was excellent. The waitress (not sure of her name), was very friendly and prompt - even when she got super busy and apologized for the wait for our drinks! Dude! We waited like 2 minutes if that! lol The owner is amazing and is so hands on in this business and that's what I like to see. I don't respect owners that are sitting somewhere in an office or at home.   I must add that the Diamond is about a 30 minute drive for me - but it's my new favorite place to eat or drink and worth it! Great food, great prices, great service, great atmosphere =)

Y_kdJwLh0cZbdUO3WbDW7w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I come here because the food is homemade, the flavors are amazing, and they take pride in sourcing and preparing a menu that incorporates quality ingredients. This diner is miles above any other diner I've been to, especially in North Carolina. Haven't had anything on the menu that I wouldn't order again!

69L49Fn7s3lEwqBmbBaDIA.text: I've now tried The Diamond twice since it's reopening and I'm done. If the food is good, then I'll ignore the parking situation and the wait to get in, but it's not. I've had the patty melt which had no flavor and the prime rib sandwich. They asked how I wanted it cooked but the meat was so thin and tough you couldn't tell anything about it. I had to add A1 to get any flavor. It's served on a regular hamburger bun that fell apart with the toughness of the meat. The fries were nothing to write home about. My friend had the veggie burger which was inedible due to the seasoning. The soydog was served in the stupid paper cups that will tilt over and drop your dog on the table at ease.  The servers are friendly and the remodel is enjoyable but the food needs work.

WjgAN_O_ndnHkx_La92AaA.text: Ever since Penguingate I've been so ready for the Diamond to open.  And then it did.  And due to transportation issues, I couldn't go.  Not until last week!  Despite lots of interaction with the twitter (they #FFed me!  *tear*  True love!)  and staring moodily and jealously at my friend's frequent foursquare check-ins, i just COULD NOT manage a way to get myself in those doors.  And then I did.    I'm actually glad I wasn't able to come for so long because it seems like they're really in stride now, as opposed to the early hiccups that come from being a super-hyped, newly opened restaurant in a fiercely loyal neighborhood.  I heard about all the kinks and wrung my hands with worry...but I think we're okay now.    Immediately upon entering my friend and I were summoned to the bar for hugs...we knew literally every person sitting there, including the hostess and a few of the waiters.  It being a monday night, it wasn't super crowded and we got our table lickety-split.  Of course I had to try the small block and the fried pickles first...duh.    And they did NOT disappoint.  Everything I loved about the Bird's burger, yet somehow even better than I remembered!  Maybe it's because I chose to love them before I even tried the food, most likely it's because it's just that good.  The fried pickles were also just as I remembered them.  I can't wait to try the new stuff, now, particularly the po greek boy and the crab dip.    Also, despite hearing a lot of stories about super long waits, our orders were taken and the food was brought out super fast.    Great prices, great food, great atmosphere, great people, great location...this really deserves it's WOOHOO!  As good as it gets!  review from me.  I'll be back.  I may move in.

VYO6jY2bm3PviNYT1I9b6Q.text: I purchased the LivingSocial deal and decided to check it out while I was home.  It is a hidden treasure to those of us outside of the NoDa/Plaza Midwood area.  The portions are huge and I enjoyed my meal.  I will definitely go back.

cVTfGqkiIqXmZ4dA6NneRg.text: Terrible experience. We went here to get a drink at the bar and when we sat down, it seemed we had taken someone's seat (apparently it was obvious because his drink was there-according to the bartender). He then starts nudging one of the men we were with so we decided to move down. While this is happening he is communicating with the bartender and both are glaring at us even after this occurred. We then are looking at the bartender to get a second drink and I kid you not she yells "YOU GOT A PROBLEM" from the other side of the bar. It was at that moment that i realized, "Oh! This bartender is obviously a crazy person. Great." All the while I'm finding this experience hilarious so while she was ignoring us I said "You got a problem?" as she looked my way. This only made her totally lose her mind and she yells "LOOK IF YOU HAVE A F**KING PROBLEM YOU CAN JUST GET OUT!" So we all decided it was probably time to go before the bartender murders us. She then storms to the kitchen and brings out a manager who says "You guys need to leave now." So we, now pretty irritated and confused, told her as soon as we finished our beers we would be out of there. This is when it gets pretty crazy. The manager storms out from behind the bar, towards us and grabs my beer out of my hand, spilling some on me (which I really don't care that much about but still) and goes to grab a woman we were also with's drink out of HER hand. Now she had a full drink so she was a little less than thrilled that they were taking it away after we had paid for it, so she refused to let her have it. THEN the bartender lunges for the drink and is on top of this woman, grabs the drink and we pretty much spring out to the applause of the staff. I really don't write reviews unless the service/food is really bad or if it's really good. It seems we were profiled as we walked in for not being locals and we were definitely treated differently. It's clear that the Diamond no longer cares about their customers and will willingly jump on top of a lady to get her drink from her. We didn't even get to try the food so I can't speak for that. But our trip to the Diamond was super weird and we won't be going back (not that they would want us back). This one stuck with me- Tread carefully.

fJlVxAv_OuPnHC3A-7CeYQ.text: I love the Diamond. I have to admit, looking at the Yelp reviews, that, yeah, not every item on the menu is great. But it's just a perfect late night place to hang out, and the fried pickles are amazing. I also recommend the burger southern style, and the alcohol, in case you still need any by the time you get there.

i7XSq_uZe7eKNzls4JQTww.text: Fried pickles were so good but rest of our food was gross and oily. The service was shitty, our waitress said "you can't be seated till the rest of your party comes" meanwhile there was a total of 5 of us. She was rude and took her sweet time. It was overall an awful experience. If you want diner food and great service I highly recommend midnight diner!

OgLTDyGlhr9jXVOSxRT3Sg.text: You can't buy this kind of authenticity! I'm originally from the "land of diners" (the Northeast) and this place takes me back right to all the best diners I've ever spent a late night in. The minute we stepped in the door we knew this was the place for us. The booths are comfy and well used, exactly what you would expect for a diner that's been in business since 1945. We we're greeted and seated within a minute of walking in the door. Our waitress was friendly and service was prompt.  We got the pig wings, the Po'Greek burger, and Mac&cheese. Let me start by saying, this place deserves five stars for it's Mac&cheese alone. Hands down. The pig wings were fall off the bone tender and the bbq dipping sauce was so good, I kept it for the fries. The burger was so good, that I literally could not stop saying "so good" as I was eating it. The fries were good, crisp and crinkle cut. My only regret was that I didn't save room for dessert but you can bet I will when we return.

QtjTGHkfHMfeHPPpLRwHJA.text: Excellent food and service. Lucky to get a spot.   Really full. Good hot dogs and fried pickles and cheese dip. Everything. But price does add up.   Service Melody great.

xEvWa75rv0eiaDgD6FgP2w.text: There is some magic in the air about The Diamond, first of all the restaurant has been around Charlotte since 1945, it's kitchy and cozy.  The guys who took it over, polished it up without overdoing it or making it too cool for school.  It is packed tightly with tables, I don't remember it being so compact on my last visit, but it works.  The powder, deep, robin's egg, Tiffany box.... blue vinyl booths give me a hard on.  I didn't know I was going to the Diamond on this sneak peek night, but Julia S. and the Mister texted me, so I headed over.  Since I wasn't hungry, I just ate a Winky Dinky dog and a shit ton of their french fries smoothered with pimento cheese and vegetarian gravy.  Jeez Louise.  I wonder what I would have consumed if I were hungry. Har, har, har.  Really, I don't even like gravy on my french fries and I could not stop eating.  The Winky Dinky dog was served on a split top white bread bun, sent straight from white bread forbidden hell and it was delicious.  It really tasted like it was fried and finished on the grill, complete with the grill taste-   4th of July when you were a kid kinda taste, topped with chili and pimento cheese.  I added raw onion and yellow mustard and called it a day.  I checked my Magic Eight Ball for the Diamond's future. Will The Diamond succeed?  It is decidedly so.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Julia S&#39;s veggie gravy, pimento cheese fries- CHOMP!

tssp-Gz5r_Af22_3ggkeow.text: Over-hyped crappy dinner food!  Calling all counterculture weirdo's, here is your culinary Mecca.  I'll break this down in three sections:  FOOD: I've tried several things on the menu and have to say it all tastes really generic. You think they would have some ham hocks in their collards? Nope! Even the fired pickles that people go nuts for are just out of the jar pickles you or I could buy and make. Burgers are meh. Their french fries are crinkle cut fried, which I find are the worst kind of fry. Reminds me of terrible cafeteria food I ate in grade school. Drinks are overpriced unless you came to drink Tall-boy Pabst Blue Ribbon.  SERVICE: 98% Chance are you will be served by an apathetic hipster with either facial piercings or covered in tattoos. The service has always been slow. I can't blame it completely on the wait staff, it could be that the food coming out of the kitchen is slow. Regardless, be ready to ask for refills if you want them.  ATMOSPHERE: If you are looking for a dumpy dive-bar were you can probably score some hepatitis C from the bathroom, then you hit the jackpot. There is a jukebox which has some interesting selection on it. Old floors and beat-up tables and booths. This place could use more than just a fresh coat of paint, but it seems like the regulars love the dumpy look. Speaking of the regulars, these people have more ink than a comic book convention.  Bottomline: Service is slow, Food is underwhelming to poor and Atmosphere is unclean. Consider traveling here only after being drunk.

G8_0o9boWDYcNk9qnRTqQg.text: Came solely for the peach cobbler and it was legit amazing. Like mama use to make. A must have, cute 50's look a must go!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Peach cobbler = amazing!

lPj7rd37JgFMGod4KsWcwQ.text: This is the perfect place to get diner food!  It's not a 5 star restaurant, and I'm not comparing it to one.  I rated it 5 stars compared to other diners.  I got the grilled cheese but added some tomato to it.  The Texas toast made it the perfect crunch and the melted cheese was very cheesy (in a good way).  I got the fried okra on the side which could have been a little more crunchy but that's me being too picky.  For appetizers, my friends and I got some hush puppies and ate them all in seconds.  We couldn't stop eating because everything was so delicious, so my friend and I got the homemade peach cobbler.  It's served with ice cream, and it's a must-get desert!  Gotta try the Diamond if you're in Plaza Midwood.

pAfchjMrI9ACpbjJcFkKJw.text: I was excited about this place but bitterly disappointed. I ordered the pulled pork which was served cold and consisted of strings of fat. I also found the waiter, Matt, rude when serving. I would highly recommend NOT going!

OhzEjbzQ8OiVCxfBErs2ZA.text: Monday is raw meatloaf day served with a side of ecoli...  I've been wanting to try the Diamond for years. I finally did... For two people at lunch, we paid just under $30 with tip. We decided to try the meatloaf special. The meatloaf was raw on the inside. The other sides were ok.  I probably won't be coming back. And I doubt I would ever recommend the Diamond to anyone.

KF5TR7-CydxxT_lbG41WfA.text: I love this cute little place. Don't expect fancy platting or the ambiance to match but the food is wonderful! Standard run of the mill options in regards to it being a diner but the taste isn't standard at all. Burgers are juicy and flavorful and their fish options are surprisingly delicious. I recommend the salmon blt!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon blt

3vvnAP8EYCuCv1O4U7CkzA.text: Bought a groupon for this place with my boyfriend so we thought we'd try it out! Cute little dinner near uptown Charlotte with Greek, Italian and home style foods. Great selection!  We came on a Tuesday night and it was packed!! Our waitress was great! I got the vegetable plate with Mac and cheese, salad, green beans and potato salad and it was so good!   Can't wait to go back and try new things!

mVhRXzdy3-oPxkvRbcSW7A.text: My boyfriend says the double block burger is one of the best burgers he's had in Charlotte. I get the breakfast - 2 eggs (add cheese), with hash browns, bacon, and a biscuit. It always hits the spot! Not expensive, and quick service. We come for a quick lunch on Sunday's and it's a great.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. A double Block burger, added bacon and cheese.

Uzt_qAyX-mWQpkLmfZcuVA.text: Love this place during normal hours but their late service is crazy slow ... limited menu thus better off hitting a drive thru unless you want to catch the sunrise while you wait for your drunk food... with a limited menu cannot even begin to comprehend why it takes 45 min ?!!!

RRiaxDMLU75rtpMPhJl03Q.text: You haven't experienced a True diner til you've stepped into Diamond Restaurant. Plain and simple comfort food with an 80s vibe and hipster crowd. Roll in after night out and get the small bloc burger all the way. It comes by itself so don't forget to add fries or onion rings.

a0WTc3FRG8W6zmHcZ9kxbw.text: Friday night's with Mo, the bartender, my fave. This is my staple,  and when I know it's going to go smooth and delicious,  all the better...in bed by 9! Yes!

aPPOZZ-q9R3gzBwgYsqJBg.text: Their late night service is a joke. Just don't even bother. I've tried to order from here so many times because I work at a bar and it's one of the only things open when I get off. But it doesn't do much good to be open late if they can't handle the volume. They refuse to do any to go orders as soon as they start getting busy and eventually just disconnect the phone line. Great customer service.... if it's past 10 you're better off going to one of the many other restaurant/bars in the area like Thomas street around the corner or to Fuel Pizza if it's after 2, they can actually handle their late night volume.

rMwqK6u1QqjvyVjHU5LEUQ.text: Good Carolina style Hot Dog. Great Hamburger and pretty good banana pudding.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Pudding

djIu20zjMEGiTku9gEdynw.text: I'm a local who has tried multiple times to give this place a shot. The terrible service will keep us from returning. You will wait forever.

VOMFAOop2KNk8edbaGcaIA.text: Best place for lunch in Charlotte been here a hundred times...food is amazing ..drinks are great & wait staff/bartenders awesome! If you looking for a great local regular place ...this is it!!!!

Cy759DtWwyfBaEGEgCwNOw.text: Had just left the Belk bowl after a disappointing game and we were wet and hungry after spending a few hours in the rain rooting for our team.  The decor is really cute, kind of a retro feel to the place.  There was a short wait for a table, but nothing major. I wasn't crazy about the chilly corner they sat us in, there was a storage area for supplies right behind us and the staff kept squeezing themselves in there to retrieve supplies, but it was busy, and we were hungry.   Our waitress was friendly but I think might have been a little distracted. Granted she had a big table she was also working on, but I was once a waitress, and I know that it's no excuse to neglect another table. Too bad for her, because we're really good tippers when we're treated right.  We ordered pickle chips for an appetizer. They took forever to come out after she assured us they'd be right out, and sure enough our entrees came out about 60 seconds after, So serving skills on busy nights definitely could be improved. That being said, the food was pretty darn good.  The pickle chips were right up there with the best we've had. The pickle had good flavor and the batter was light and crispy. I ordered a small block bacon cheeseburger, he ordered a black bean burger, we shared a basket of fries and he also had some fried okra. My burger was a 1/3 pound burger, pretty big for something called small block. It was done just the way I asked, and the bacon was crispy. His black bean burger was really good. It was a relatively thick burger, probably a 1/2 pounder, and he did polish that off. The fries were perfectly done,   crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. His fried okra was average, good but nothing special. Pitcher of beer was fairly priced, and a nice local brew. The check took a little longer than it should have to arrive at our table, but not too awful bad.   So - in conclusion - pretty darn good food but on this particular night, less than stellar service, and they really out to do away with that table in the chilly corner, or at least not double it as a storage space right behind, it's really annoying.

TGyFbUVYDtBYBRE_BbSWJQ.text: Service was good and prompt & we were seated right away. It's like a dated mom & pop restaurant,  with a bar.   We had the fried pickles to start and I must say they are the best I ever had! I gave 2 stars because the service was prompt, price is right, pickles were great but unfortunately the rest of our food was just OK (and that's generous).   We both ordered the BBQ dipped fried chicken plates with mac and cheese and collards. First off, my chicken and greens were luke warm. The greens were tasty but the chicken and mac and cheese were definitely under seasoned. I really wanted to like this place because of the reviews but this time didn't do it (2.5 stars if I had the option). There's a possibility I may give it another shot and try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ dipped fried chicken (eh..) mac and cheese (eh..) and collards (tasty)
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried pickles! The best I ever had! :)

fFGpLV15mM9gmgXbMtrpfQ.text: This place can either be hit or miss. If ordering a burger, gyro or cheese, it's excellent. I made the mistake of ordering the fried chicken. What a horrible choice. It was not freshly fried. How dare you serve old fried chicken!! Shame on you! I'll stick to the regular menu next time. Got black eyed peas and collards as sides and those were quite tasty along with the pimento cheese dip. Love getting a full basket of assorted crackers for the dip. So stick to the basics here. The price point is phenomenal for Plaza Midwood.

TMG3b9GbKbPXPT7P5BCQHQ.text: I have never in my life waited so long for a very very plain burger and a to go meal. I think we have been here two hours and the service is horrible! These people actual must think the wait time is normal. I will never ever be back. I love places like this but DAMN!!!

iVRmCxiwiaqqE22nH7ORTQ.text: It's decent enough, but not much to write home about. Maybe I just don't order well (I'm not huge into burgers or fried stuff), but I don't understand the legendary hype; everything seems bland, and hasn't come out piping hot, either. Each time I've eaten here, I leave feeling like, "Well, that's a meal I should have had somewhere else."

vxie_30-sE4ObfvLV2NO_Q.text: Horrible experience. Manager and bartender were discriminating against me for no apparent reason. They tried to blame because I had an out of state ID  but then I asked the manager and she said it's cause we do not want to serve you. DIAMOND BAR DISCRIMINATES AGAIST I WOULD BEWARE

qlFLtD7Ti0eo72UzuOnLbw.text: Diamond in the rough!! This place has it down!!! Great food! Fun atmosphere, and the staff are all filled with sweetness! First time here today, but not the last. No wonder they have been around so long!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gyro platter almost destroyed. Gooooood!!!!

fd2uGfp-1oUnjBTN2q69Yw.text: Straight up Charlotte royalty right here.  Great food. Cool people.  Plaza Midwood icon.  Get the collards!

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. When I return to Charlotte from the road this is usually my first stop! Food&#39;s great and the staff&#39;s even better!

ysPlA4aHWKW1ud3pOJiRfw.text: I'm only giving this place three stars because I have friends that work or have worked here. The food is really not all that great though. I got to order of onion rings that could have easily been mistaken for a salt lick. Gravy fries are safe bet. I really think most people just started coming here because of all the drama with the penguin. I know that's why I did. That being said it's a fairly Chill Spot to take a date or have some drinks, but again the food is meh

IVCTtZxpid1SxFgy-xpFsQ.text: I had the fried pickles which were very good! Then me and my husband split a gyros which was pretty good too. Had the catfish also but was under seasoned and not one I would go back for. It was fried with flour but should have been cornmeal.

7gAGDlwx7cSmFwszRoDk2g.text: This is a nice little place from home style cooking...not a home run, but good.  The Diamond has a positive bohemian vibe to it and I enjoy it for lunch.  The food can be a bit inconsistent but overall it's fine, the specials are generally very good (go for Meatloaf Monday).  One of the best parts about the Diamond is Debbie the server, she is just terrific, shout out to Debbie.

ll_Trgy4TNdlfK-KJnKxwQ.text: Me and my husband love this diner, probably one of our favorites in plaza midwood. They changed their Black bean burger recently  (which was my favorite item on the menu) and it just isn't as good. But other than that, it's great service and the food is really good!

d5u0DiDt2gdFA2ooJ2-3hQ.text: Great Southern Comfort food with friendly service.  The fried pickles are awesome.  We had Bbq (above average), NC style crab cakes (average), biscuits (average), fries okra (cold), and sweet tea (great).  The place is kind of rundown, which is part of its appeal, but also makes it slightly uncomfortable.  Most of the wait staff is covered in tats, which doesn't bother me, but might make some uncomfortable.

Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. NC Style pulled pork
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

jNv1BgtVLuRH04zcWt9waA.text: I have received poor service and poor food both times I have been here. I tried to give them a second chance but the service is so slow. During my first visit they just forgot about us. Personally I think the food isn't great so it isn't worth suffering through bad service.

7cbd0r3gbzeENc6gCL1s6Q.text: Went here after the recent Steelers/Panthers game. Was surprised to see that there wasn't a wait at all. We were escorted directly to a comfty booth.  The place was nice and cool and had the end of the Panthers game on tv.  Shortly after being seated, a gentleman promptly came and took our food and drink orders.  Shortly thereafter, our drinks arrived and we placed our orders.  I ordered the "Diamond Dog" and a "Small bloc" all-the-way with pepper-jack cheese.  My girlfriend ordered a side salad and the spaghetti (which I would have never ordered by the way...I mean its not like we were at Mamma Ricattas!).  The salad arrived almost immediately.  As for the rest of our order, well lets just say, if we would have held our breaths while waiting for our order, our bodies would've decayed and turned back to ashes and dirt.  It def didn't seem crowded, and they certainly seemed to have plenty of staffing on hand.  So its anyone's guess as to what was going on back there...??  WHEN the food finally arrived, myself and the four other people I was with, were less than satisfied.  My girlfriend was disappointed with her spaghetti.  She said it didn't have any real flavor, was bland and a bit runny; yuck!  I can't say as the burger was THAT bad.  The pepper-jack cheese added a nice touch.  As for the hot dog , well it was a hot dog.  It was good, not great.  It was about what I would've EXPECTED it to be, but not what I would've HOPED it would be.      I am not gonna get into whether the Diamond is better than the Penguin or not, because to be honest, I've had less than steller experiences there as well.  Everything about this place is average to me.  Our waiter was a nice bro, but our food took forever to arrive.  My food was decent, but my gf hated her food.  Go here once, just to see what the hype is all about, then go explore the many other options in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. small block w/pepper-jack cheese

_t2Wj5cBDHTIwSB63iieRg.text: I have been here for lunch several times, and it is a good value. Not great. Food is cheap which is why I went today with a friend, just because I have eaten out a lot lately and wanted to save a bit. The Hostess/waitress was a very rude young nose pierced girl who seemed annoyed about everything. I would like to think that of all dining establishments, and I eat out a lot over the last 30 years living here, Diamond employees would treat everyone the same. Wrong. I was eating with an african american friend and she was snubbed, big time. My friend asked me if I noticed it, which of course I said yes. The waitress was outwardly more rude to my friend, not looking at her and not addressing her, but myself. My friend paid for lunch and of course the girl practically threw the bill at her. I use to wait tables and I would have never conducted myself this way, especially if I expected a tip. I will not come back.

O0aOjjGQ_SO47r9R67ljjg.text: I came on a Sunday night but the place was still poppin. It's a hipster scene with a soul food menu. I had the fried pickles which were great! Not to much breading. The chicken livers were my main course (yeah I know..) and it was nice that they even had those. They were cooked perfectly. Great bar food for a good price!

LwmzxaC6qnGewgq_JXr4GA.text: Yo this place is ridiculous.. I had a monster burger that reminded me of the old Penguin Hemi burger.. Anyway, we were a little tipsy and hungry and stumbled upon this place.. Great find.. Could not remember where we went or the name of it.. Alcohol is a drug.. LOL.. Will definitely go back///

BfIvq5MRE9y8DsitK-8IQw.text: Tried this place for the first time the other night, have to say echo the chorus of people leaving negative reviews of the staff.  Some of the rudest management staff I have seen in any restaurant!  The weekend hostess and the manager make a place with average food (at best) unbearable.  With as many options in that part of town,  when the place shuts down for running off clientele with their poor attitudes, it will not be missed.  Based on a multitude of reviews that have shared similar bad experiences with the staff and their poor attitudes, don't hold your breath expecting any improvements.

oQ5t7EJXlq-ecPgAghRGyA.text: Being new to Charlotte, I've heard a lot about the Diamond so I decided to check it out. We went on a Thursday night and there was a lot of activity. It's an old dinner with a modern/hipster twist; the kind of place that's got 1960's wallpaper (a green-ish pattern of cork screws, measuring cups and other kitchen utensils) and a guy with tattoos and gauges walking you to your table. The employees were all really polite and down to earth.  The food did take a long time, but it was definitely worth the wait, as it all tasted really good and the waiter let us know that due to the wait it was on the house, which was very nice of them. Most chain restaurants won't go out of your way to give you a great experience but the Diamond was a great local gem that cares a lot about customer service.   I'd definitely come here again and would recommend it to anyone.

j0tnLYpJuzac_DOQ_BB4DQ.text: After being seated and not even having a waitress approach us for the first 15 mins we assumed the food would be quicker than the service. Wrong. After sitting for 1 hour and 15 mins and no food, we left. Good sweet tea. Spoke to three people in their and none of them were happy. I don't plan to return for a while.

nM2Hepft6T9ZbL2wJOOkWA.text: Such a fun place.  I loved the kitschy retro decor here.  Our server was courteous and attentive but not annoying.  The food was really good the portions were excellent.  We ordered the pickle chips and the Greek Platter to share.  This is a real "diamond" in downtown Charlotte.  The Penguin has nothing on this place!

Rgo-h8OhyHOMyqbIQSN0OQ.text: This place is good. I went there a week ago and food was good. Great atmosphere. Great decor I guess this place is a old staple in Charlotte and bene opened since 1945.  I have been back a few times after my first time..    1. Corn dogs and all hot dogs..  all KOSHER so if you dont like the taste of Kosher than you wont like thier hotdogs. I wish they would have just normal hotdogs.    2. Fried Chicken is good a litttle too greasy but good great flavor and seasoning. Mac nad cheese and Mash Potatoes I had as my sides..  MAC and cheese was dry  ont impressed but its a good solid recipe though thye just need to tweek it a little make sure they have more moisture in it. MashPotaoes were ok a little dry but the gravy made up for it.   3. Hamburgers good burgers but I hate the fact that thier buns are cold..  and not heated nor toasted it ruins the burger all together.    4. Fries are good and home made chips are good to.     Try it out  at least once support this staple and great establishment!

0AL9-howrO3VKbPytTxqEQ.text: Throwback Diner - good atmosphere, food, staff - had the 1/4 chicken BBQ dipped with Mac n cheese + homemade chips and 1/3 lb beef burger - all very tasty! Will go back again.

OZK_giuQdHz_22DwDPcMYA.text: I'm not huge into greasy diner food... however I will say this: Gravy. Fries. They do them well here, always add the cheddar cheese. Their block burgers hit the spot for a quick diner burger as well. Fried pickles are super heavy but good. Overall I don't hate it, but don't love it. There are a few choice things on the menu I come back for.

XBT6Jql2jWVrmucPVqcYCA.text: Maybe it should be renamed the "Cubic Zirconia" since The Diamond serves cheap, low quality Shit!   I realize that this is supposed to be a Charlotte classic.  But I wish this grease factory would disappear like the grossly overrated Penguin that was around the corner.  I am astounded by the positive reviews.  I get that it's got a unique classic vibe.  But the food is simply disgusting.    I was fully expecting a greasy spoon type of place.  And I'm just fine with indulging in something unhealthy... as long as it tastes good.  NOTHING that I ate at The Diamond tasted good.  Let's start with the onion rings.  I'm not sure there was any onion in there.  It was more like I was eating hard chunks of over fried breading.   The fried pickles were okay.  Just okay.  The burgers - How one effs up a burger this badly is beyond me.  I would rather get a burger from McDonald's.  I am Not exaggerating about this!  Skinny, way overcooked patties.  The bun looked like an obese individual rolled around on it for a while.  The lettuce was wilted.  And there was No flavor.  With all of the heavy stuff that I was ordering I figured I'd order one lighter item, so I went with the Grecian Meze Platter.  BLECH!!! I don't think it was possible to screw this up.  I really didn't!  The pitas seemed stale rather than the claimed "toasted".  But the real highlight for me was the hummus.  I was looking forward to some creamy, flavorful goodness.  This hummus looked like something out of "Two Girls, One Cup".  And by that I mean "Shit in a Cup".  It was Rock Hard.  It was not possible to dip one of the stale pitas into it.  I tried. The stale pita broke.  I stuck my knife into the "hummus" and let go.  The knife didn't budge.  It just stood there standing straight up.    If you want to clog your arteries, at least make it worth it.  Ingest your grease somewhere other than The Diamond.

hGZBv7PLJC8XmMud17JXVw.text: Small diner that can get pretty crowded but with good, cheap grub and $5 pitchers it can't be beat.  They have lots of options aside from the classic diner fare.  I highly recommend their meatless loaf with soy mashed potatoes.  It's a huge, delicious vegan fest that is more than one person can devour in  a single sitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States. men&#39;s rooms ambiance
Photo of Diamond Restaurant - Charlotte, NC, United States

UO2TP5Qxmui4UKsIXEtKVg.text: My experience wasn't the greatest, but also wasn't the worst.  The waitress was really cute and friendly, but wasn't on-top of her game.  I ordered the pulled pork and fries.  The fries were horrible!!  The pulled pork was average to say the least.  I expected more from the Diamond, but I would like to try some other menu options before I tell people not to go to this place.  It was okay.

eMBSNo3Hnv1VlqhCRDZ3Mg.text: I went with my wife for lunch we were curious since we use to go to Penguin, and was a little disappointed the food was bland and the service was just o.k.

sEUmzqwc5VpLHxUFGqumpQ.text: Charlotte institution that has gained all my business since the ugly Penguin divorce happened.

axAx6YJe1gxL1vIRzPEHEg.text: Now, this was an unexpected treat.  Had lunch with a native that lives nearby this gem.  It's got that roadside diner history, but slightly re-imagined with a tad of kitschy flair.  Apparently, this is the joint where Agent Carrie Mattheson on the show Homeland freaks out in season one.  I think she must have ordered a full boat of fried pickles.  What is that?  Didn't know such a thing is a staple in Southern Cuisine.  Three big dudes, plenty of pickles left over.  I opted for a patty melt and it was friggin' divine.  This is classic Southern diner fare and me likey.  Service was great, place was hopping mid-week, tucked away in a trendy neighborhood.  Don't spend time in Charlotte and drop by this joint for a satisfying lunch.
